'''Alpha v1.0.11''', also known as '''Seecret Friday 6''', is the sixth [[seecret update]] and the fourth of [[Java Edition Alpha]], released on July 23, 2010.<ref>[[wordofnotch:849753725|Seecret Friday 6! OooooOOOoo!]] – The Word of Notch, July 23, 2010</ref> It added many new [[item]]s and [[block]]s, the [[slime]], and made other changes.

== Additions ==
{{Additions table
|Clay
|Clay Ball
|Sugar Cane
|Paper
|Book
|Brick
|Slimeball
}}
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Clay JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Clay]]'''
* Generates near water bodies.
* Drops 4 clay balls when destroyed.
* Can be crafted from 4 clay balls in a 2&times;2 crafting area.
{{Crafting Table
|A2=Clay Ball
|A3=Clay Ball
|B2=Clay Ball
|B3=Clay Ball
|Output=Clay
}}

'''[[File:Sugar Cane JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Reeds]]'''
* Can be found next to [[beach]]es.
* Can grow up to 3 blocks tall.

=== Items ===
'''[[File:Book JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Book]]'''
* Crafted from 3 paper in a column in the workbench.
{{Crafting table
|B1=Paper
|B2=Paper
|B3=Paper
|Output=Book
}}

'''[[File:Brick JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Brick]]'''
* Obtained from [[smelting]] clay balls.

'''[[File:Clay Ball JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Clay ball]]'''
* 4 are dropped when a [[clay block]] is broken.

'''[[File:Paper JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Paper]]'''
* [[Crafted]] from 3 reeds in a row in the workbench.
{{Crafting table
|A2=Sugar Cane
|B2=Sugar Cane
|C2=Sugar Cane
|Output=Paper,3
}}

'''[[File:Slimeball JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Slimeball]]'''
* Dropped by the smallest slimes, however, it currently has no use.

=== Mobs ===
'''[[File:Slime JE1.png|32px]] [[Slime]]'''
* A [[hostile mob]] which splits into smaller slimes upon [[death]].
* There are three sizes: small, medium, and big.
* Splits only when killed by the fist and not with swords.
* Spawn only below Y=32.
* Big has: {{hp|16}}, Medium has: {{hp|4}}, Small has: {{hp|1}}.

== Changes ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Bookshelf JE1.png|32px]] [[Bookshelves]]'''
* Are given a crafting recipe, crafted from [[planks]] and [[book]]s, making them obtainable legitimately again.
{{Crafting table
|A1=[Wooden Planks]Oak Planks
|A2=Book
|A3=[Wooden Planks]Oak Planks
|B1=[Wooden Planks]Oak Planks
|B2=Book
|B3=[Wooden Planks]Oak Planks
|C1=[Wooden Planks]Oak Planks
|C2=Book
|C3=[Wooden Planks]Oak Planks
|Output=Bookshelf}}
* Nothing falls after mining.

'''[[File:Bricks JE2 BE1.png|32px]] [[Bricks]]'''
* Texture changed from [[File:Bricks JE1.png|32px]].
* Are given a crafting recipe, crafted from [[brick]] items in a 2&times;2 crafting area, making them legitimately obtainable again.
{{Crafting table
|A2=Brick
|A3=Brick
|B2=Brick
|B3=Brick
|Output=Bricks}}
* They break faster with pickaxes.
** The tier of the pickaxe doesn't affect the speed at which the bricks are mined.

'''[[File:Cactus JE2 BE1.png|32px]] [[Cactus]]'''
* Texture and model changed from [[File:Cactus JE1.png|32px]].
* Cacti now causes [[damage]] to mobs only if they touch it or collide with it.
* Cacti can now only be placed on [[sand]].
* Can no longer be placed directly next to blocks.
** Placing blocks next to cacti now destroys it.

=== Items ===
'''General'''
* Player's held [[item]]s display differently from the [[third person]].

'''[[File:Milk Bucket JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Milk Bucket]]'''
* [[Milk]] can now be obtained by right-clicking a [[cow]] with a [[bucket]].

'''{{Animate|Wooden Shovel JE1 BE1.png; Stone Shovel JE1 BE1.png; Iron Shovel JE2 BE1.png; Golden Shovel JE1.png; Diamond Shovel JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Shovel]]'''
* All [[shovel]]s except for wooden now destroy [[snow]] layers instantly.

=== World generation ===
'''General'''
* Added clay blocks to the terrain generator.
* Added reeds to the terrain generator.
* Changed the generation of [[tree]]s.
* Changed the generation of [[flower]] patches.</onlyinclude>

== Trivia ==
* This was the only ''Java Edition'' release ending in <code>.11</code> until [[Java Edition 1.21.11]], which released over 15 years later.
